00029 #ifndef _MUX_BASE_H_
00030 #define _MUX_BASE_H_
00031 
00032 #include "in1out.h"
00033 #include "queue.h"
00034 
00035 class   muxBase:        public  in1out {
00036    typedef      in1out  baseclass;
00037    
00038  public:        
00039    muxBase(void): evtLate(this, 0){
00040       // turn on parsing buffer size by init()
00041       // can be changed by constructors of derived
00042       // classes
00043       doParseBufSiz = TRUE;     
00044    }
00045    struct       inpstruct {
00046       data      *pdata;
00047       int       inp;
00048    };
00049    
00050    void init(void);
00051    int  command(char *, tok_typ *);
00052    rec_typ      REC(data *, int);       // REC is a macro normally expanding to rec (for debugging)
00053    int  export(exp_typ *);
00054    void dropItem(inpstruct *);
00055    
00056    int  ninp;                   // # of inputs
00057    int  max_vci;
00058    
00059    event        evtLate;                // event for the late() method (called if arrival)
00060    
00061    queue        q;                      // system queue, does *not* include server
00062    data *server;                // the server: contains the data item which currently is played out
00063    
00064    tim_typ      serviceTime;            // length of one output time slot (in simulation time steps)
00065    
00066    int  doParseBufSiz;          // TRUE: parse the buffer size in init()
00067    // can be turned off by derived classes
00068    
00069    int  needToSchedule;         // TRUE: first arrival during this time step: activate late()
00070    
00071    unsigned int *lost;          /* one loss counter per input line */
00072    unsigned int *lostVCI;       // loss counter per VC
00073    unsigned     lossTot;        // total losses
00074    
00075    inpstruct    *inp_buff;      /* buffer for cells arriving in the early slot phase */
00076    inpstruct    *inp_ptr;       /* current position in inp_buff */
00077 };
00078 
00079 #endif  // _MUX_BASE_H_
